"If you are confident and experienced, you might like to pick and choose specific investments that you put into your pension." A conventional chain of thought stemming from an often highly regulated financial advice sector which (via choice) is often a net benefactor itself through fees and affiliate marketing. A contrarian view may be that actually since the advent of cheap global index trackers and multi-asset funds invested across thousands of companies within a multitude of sectors across the world... little investment experience/ confidence is actually required. Workplace selected pensions often have higher fees, a UK home bias and a risk/ allocation blend that (at some point) will hinder all beneficiaries. Over one's career using a workplace pension to invest statutory employee/ employer contributions into a cheap global index tracker held within a SIPP will statistically outperform the vast majority (if not all) workplace selected pension funds over a working life.
